com.decoded.zool.announcer

Class ZoolAnnouncer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.decoded.zool.announcer.ZoolAnnouncer

  • public class ZoolAnnouncer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the service between clients and zookeeper. This service will manage the announcements / hosts as well as destroy nodes / services when hosts no longer are announcing. Bind / Inject this class after binding to ZoolServiceMesh

public ZoolAnnouncer(ZoolServiceMesh zoolServiceMesh)

    • Method Detail

      • setAnnouncementProcessorInterval

        public ZoolAnnouncer setAnnouncementProcessorInterval(int announcementProcessorInterval)
        Set the interval (in milliseconds) to process announcements. This processor is only scheduled when announcements are made
        Parameters:
        announcementProcessorInterval - the length of time to wait before processing announcements. E.g. in a very low volume server, this could be 0 where each announcement is directly written (because latency will be negligible). on a higher volume, this could be 1 to 5 seconds, enough time to aggregate and predictably acquireGatewayHosts without creating backpressure.
        Returns:
        this announcer.

      • getZoolServiceMesh

        public ZoolServiceMesh getZoolServiceMesh()
        Returns the zool service mesh, which knows the underlying network representation (for internal use).
        Returns:
        ZoolServiceMesh

      • start

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ZoolAnnouncement>>> start()
        Start the Zilli Service. You must call this prior to making it available to incoming traffic.
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture with the service mesh

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the service, disconnecting from zool.

      • reportMissing

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ServiceGateway> reportMissing(java.lang.String serviceKey,
                                                                    java.lang.String remoteHostUrl)
        Report Missing. This can be invoked by any host trying to reach another known network host. If that host returns a 404, this can be called to schedule a health check on a single host.
        Parameters:
        serviceKey - the service key
        remoteHostUrl - a host url
        Returns:
        the service map

      • stageAnnouncement

        public java.lang.String stageAnnouncement(java.lang.String serviceKey,
                                          java.lang.String hostUrl,
                                          int hostPort,
                                          boolean isSecure)
        Stages an announcement of a service host on the service gateway for a service key.
        Parameters:
        serviceKey - the service key.
        hostUrl - the service host url.
        hostPort - the service host port.
        isSecure - true if this host is a secure host.
        Returns:
        the token created by gateway service for the announcer.

      • getMeshNetwork

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ServiceGateway> getMeshNetwork()
        Returns the Client representation of the mesh network of hosts that are available on the network.
        Returns:
        a Map of ServiceGateway keyed by service key, each containing available hosts for a service.

      • getHosts

        public java.util.List<ServiceHost> getHosts(java.lang.String serviceKey)
        Return the set of hosts for a service key.
        Parameters:
        serviceKey - a service key for hosts to select from.
        Returns:
        a list of ServiceHost
